main.name: Jolene Hoang
main.description: Heading to bridge technology and business, I am interested into topics related to front-end technology, data analysis and entrepreneurial social capital
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Do not hestitate to contact me through e-mail or phone :)

resume.skillmessage: Front-end development with a sense of business. React + Redux is my favorite combination, but I'm eager to learn more JS frameworks and libraries.

education.description: Major degree in Information and Knowledge Management, and minor in Asian Business Cultures. The program focuses on information management in internal and external organisation processes with a comprehensive range of stakeholder groups.
Employment of machine learning methods in a business environment, broad understanding of big data analytics, descriptive and predictive modelling, as well as optimization.
Major in International Business puts emphasis especially on international business environment awareness, intercultural adaptability, communication skills and international operations management.

work.title: Junior Front-end Developer
work.description: Focused on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React/Redux, Node and MongoDB. Contributed to build up a new assessment tool for new students.

work.title: Marketing Specialist
work.description: Managed webshop and searched for international distributors. Analyzed the market data for the company's branding process

work.title: Logistics Assistant
work.description: Database management through CRM system. Worked with the new project of optimizing packing solutions

work.title: International Marketing Specialist
work.description: Prepared marketing and tutorial materials for English-speaking customers. Recruited and supervised trainees for the company's projects

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
